intro: Astartea ambigua, commonly known as the ambiguous starwort, is a perennial herb native to the wetlands of North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and thrives in wetland environments. Its flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer, are white to pale green and attract various pollinators. Astartea ambigua is often found in marshes, swamps, and along the edges of ponds.
